author: gkrintir
body:
**PR description**:

This fixes the pileup scenario for the 2016 ultra legacy (periods B-H), i.e., 

 "2016_25ns_UltraLegacy_PoissonOOTPU"

from #28595 noted by @srimanob @ameyer-cern and reported by TSG et al: @missirol @pgunnell @Sam-Harper @gennai 

In the validation plot below:

- black the pileup distribution from this PR

- red the pileup 'all 2016' distribution from this [presentation](https://indico.cern.ch/event/870037/contributions/3670166/attachments/1960095/3257291/Pileup20191210.pdf) that can be found [here](https://github.com/CMS-LUMI-POG/PileupTools/blob/master/Results2016UL/pileup_2016_eras.png) too 

![UL16_PU](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11335283/78832043-3cd4b780-79b0-11ea-8814-bbde4409c3ed.png)

As for the bug, I had checked that the file didn't break the workflow:

/afs/cern.ch/user/g/gkrintir/public/ForPileup

but indeed it seems I didn't carefully investigate  

/afs/cern.ch/user/g/gkrintir/public/ForPileup/histProbFunction.root

Regards and very sorry for that once more :(
title: fixed bug in UL16 PU profile
